scenario:
ExxonMobil, Illinois Tool Works, and the JPMorgan Equity Premium Income ETF are considered reliable candidates to buy in 2025 due to their ability to endure a market sell-off and maintain or raise their dividends. 

ExxonMobil has a 3.6% forward-yielding dividend and has maintained a streak of hiking its dividend for 42 consecutive years. The company expects steady growth from 2024 to 2030, with earnings and operating cash flow rising at compound annual growth rates of 10% and 8%, respectively. 

Illinois Tool Works has a 2.3% yield and has increased its dividend for 53 consecutive years. The company's diversification and high operating margins make it well-positioned to absorb a slowdown in certain segments. 

The JPMorgan Equity Premium Income ETF yields 7.3% and generates monthly income through a combination of equity investments and equity-linked notes that sell monthly call options linked to the S&P 500 index. The ETF is designed to perform relatively well in a market sell-off and continue to generate income for investors. 

These investments are considered suitable for investors seeking predictable passive income flows and looking to avoid assuming a high yield is too good to be true.
